intro: Pentadesma rutshuruensis, commonly known as the Kivu wood or African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is valued for its durable, aromatic timber. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, it is considered a vulnerable species.
